sn12.38:4.2: “Mendicants, what you intend or plan, and what you have tendencies for become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.38:4.3: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.38:4.4: When consciousness is established and grows, there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
sn12.38:4.5: When there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future, future birth, old age, and death come to be, as do sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.38:4.6: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.38:5.1: If you don’t intend or plan, but still have tendencies, this becomes a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.38:5.2: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.38:5.3: When consciousness is established and grows, there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
sn12.38:5.4: When there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future, future birth, old age, and death come to be, as do sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.38:5.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.38:6.1: If you don’t intend or plan or have tendencies, this doesn’t become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.38:6.2: With no support, consciousness is not established.
sn12.38:6.3: When consciousness is not established and doesn’t grow, there’s no rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
sn12.38:6.4: When there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future, future birth, old age, and death cease, as do sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.38:6.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
